SEARCH
Package state

Class WorkQueue

java.lang.Object
state.WorkQueue
public class WorkQueue extends Object
Represents a queue of WorkItem objects with thread-safe operations. This class provides methods to add and retrieve work items in a thread-safe manner.
Since:
5 July 2024
Version:
0.1
Author:
Robert Smith

  • Constructor Details

    • WorkQueue

      public WorkQueue()
      Constructs an empty WorkQueue.

    • WorkQueue

      public WorkQueue(WorkItem gate)
      Constructs a WorkQueue with an initial WorkItem.
      Parameters:
      gate - The initial WorkItem to be added to the queue.

  • Method Details

    • getGates

      public Queue<WorkItem> getGates()
      Returns a copy of the internal queue of WorkItem objects. Note: This method provides a thread-safe copy of the queue.
      Returns:
      A new Queue containing the WorkItem objects.

    • addGate

      public void addGate(WorkItem gate)
      Adds a new WorkItem to the queue in a thread-safe manner.
      Parameters:
      gate - The WorkItem to be added to the queue.
      See Also:
      • WorkItem

    • addGate

      public void addGate(String type, int target)
      Adds a new WorkItem to the queue in a thread-safe manner, for single qubit gates.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of gate to use as a string.
      target - The target qubit for the gate.
      See Also:
      • WorkItem

    • addGate

      public void addGate(String type, int control, int target)
      Adds a new WorkItem to the queue in a thread-safe manner, for single control, single target gates.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of gate to use as a string.
      control - The control qubit for the gate.
      target - The target qubit for the gate.
      See Also:
      • WorkItem

    • addGate

      public void addGate(String type, int control, int target, int target2)
      Adds a new WorkItem to the queue in a thread-safe manner, for single control, dual target gates.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of gate to use as a string.
      control - The control qubit for the gate.
      target - The first target qubit for the gate.
      target2 - The second qubit target for this gate.
      See Also:
      • WorkItem

    • addGate

      public void addGate(String type, Integer[] controls, Integer[] targets)
      Adds a new WorkItem to the queue in a thread-safe manner, for multi control, multi or single target gate.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of gate to use as a string.
      controls - The control array of qubits for the gate.
      targets - The target array of qubits for the gate.
      See Also:
      • WorkItem

    • getNextGate

      public WorkItem getNextGate()
      Removes and returns the next WorkItem from the queue in a thread-safe manner.
      Returns:
      The next WorkItem in the queue, or null if the queue is empty.

    • hasWork

      public boolean hasWork()
      Checks if there are any WorkItem objects in the queue.
      Returns:
      true if the queue is not empty, false otherwise.

    • peek

      public WorkItem peek()
      Provides peek functionality into the WorkQueue. It is primarily used for iterating through the work queue while executing the work queue to ensure all work items are executed and execution stops when WorkQueue is empty.
      Example Use:

      while(WorkItem.peek() !=null){ //business logic here }

      Returns:
      a WorkItem copy of the next WorkItem in the WorkQueue. A copy is returned to avoid user attempting to mutate the existing WorkItem in the WorkQueue directly.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
